issue.title: #3306 introduced at least one bug
issue.body:
### Bug Report

replacing all `==` to `===` and `!==` to `!==` should not be made with cs fixer as this can cause bugs for example here: https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/blob/72b4e777543e19a67c9b94edb3f23d7b3e523be5/lib/Doctrine/DBAL/Schema/Comparator.php#L435  

|    Q        |   A
|------------ | ------
| BC Break    | no
| Version     | 2.9.x-dev

#### Summary

Becouse of #3306 change `!=` to `!==` now Schema comparator return false changes

#### Current behaviour

incorrectly treats default value because from database it returns string `'1'` but  schema retun integer `1` and counts as changed default value

#### How to reproduce

doctrine/dbal:2.9.x-dev
maraidb:10.2.14 and mariadb:10.3.10
```
/**
 * @ORM\Column(type="integer", options={"default" = 1})
 */
protected $fuelType;
```
```
doctrine-module orm:schema-tool:update --dump-sql
ALTER TABLE purchase CHANGE fuelType fuelType INT DEFAULT 1 NOT NULL;
```
#### Expected behaviour

```
doctrine-module orm:schema-tool:update --dump-sql
[OK] Nothing to update - your database is already in sync with the current entity metadata
```

issue.title: Fix support for URL to account for master-slave and pooling-shard connections
issue.body:
|      Q       |   A
|------------- | -----------
| Type         | bug/feature
| BC Break     | no
| Fixed issues | 

#### Summary

When adding support for url-based configuration, it was implemented at the DriverManager level rather than at the Connection level (which indeed has a bunch of advantages). Due to that, MasterSlaveConnection and PoolingShardConnection were missing support for the URL because the params are not at the top-level, but in sub-keys.
Moving the parsing of the URL to the connection itself when dealing with params would probably require much more work than making DriverManager aware of the config structure for these 2 special connections. 

I would consider it as a bugfix for the URL support (and so I hope it gets cherry-picked at least in 2.7), but that's your choice.

issue.title: Fixed coding standard violations in the codebase
issue.body:
<!-- Fill in the relevant information below to help triage your pull request. -->

|      Q       |   A
|------------- | -----------
| Type         | improvement
| BC Break     | no

The coding standard violations have been fixed in `bin/` and `lib/`. Besides the automated fixes via `phpcbf`, the following was changed:

1. Fixed the issues which `phpcbf` couldn't fix.
2. Removed leading underscore from private class memeber names.
3. Replaced class names represented by strings with the `::class` syntax
4. Removed some remaining license headers
5. Replaced `diff-sniffer` with PHP_CodeSniffer for pull request validation, made the stage required.

issue.title: Implemented comparison of default values as strings regardless of their PHP types
issue.body:
|      Q       |   A
|------------- | -----------
| Type         | bug
| BC Break     | no
| Fixed issues | #3336

Compare default values as strings (as they appear in SQL and introspected schema) regardless of their PHP types.

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
